data.title: Transfer Agreements and Information: By Institution
data.text:
American Public University System Websitenew window

Learning Format: Online

American Military University and American Public University, part of the American Public University System (APUS), welcome you to enjoy the benefits of our partnership with Montgomery College. It is designed to offer you the most transfer credits possible to help you complete your bachelor’s degree quickly and efficiently. With your conferred associate degree, the University System awards up to 30 credits toward your general education requirement with up to 90 transfer credits possible for prior learning, work experience, military experience, and professional training. *

Get started with a transfer credit evaluationnew window

APUS is committed to providing access to high-quality, affordable education. We offer 200+ online degrees and certificates for motivated working professionals seeking to make a difference.

American Public Universitynew window students typically represent those working in business, healthcare, education, and public service settings, as well as other mission-driven communities. Throughout our history, we have held to our core principle to provide affordable, accessible, and career-relevant education to prepare students for service and leadership in a diverse, global society. Learn more on APU’s Montgomery College partnership pagenew window.

Are you a servicemember, military spouse/dependent, or veteran? You may feel right at home at American Military Universitynew window. AMU is the #1 provider of higher education to the U.S. military and veterans, based on 2019 Department of Defense tuition assistance and Veterans Administration student enrollment data, as reported by Military Times, 2020. AMU students benefit from the same quality online education with a focus on affordability, convenience, and flexibility. Learn more on AMU’s Montgomery College partnership pagenew window.

How we make your education affordable:

$285/undergraduate credit hour

$0 textbooks/ebooks for all undergraduates

Tech fee waiver for all Montgomery College graduates

$0 application fee

$0 transfer credit evaluation

No entrance exams

More reasons to choose APUS:

Convenience: Benefit from weekly class schedules with no set login times.

Flexibility: Classes start monthly with mostly 8-week formats, so you can begin on your schedule.

Respected: American Public University System is accredited by the Higher Learning Commission (hlcommission.org), an institutional accreditation agency recognized by the U.S. Department of Education.

* The University applies transfer credits within current policies and procedures.

Contact Information:

American Public University System

Phone: 855-929-5264

Email: info@apus.edu

George Mason University Websitenew window

Minimum Cumulative GPA Required: 2.0

Associate's Degree Required? Yes

Learning Format: In-Person

Transfer Agreement

Cloud Computing Specialization AAS to Cloud Computing Concentration BAS (PDF, )

Enrollment Agreement

Complete an AA, AS, or AAS at MC with a 2.85 GPA or higher to receive guaranteed admission to George Mason (not necessarily into any major, just admission to George Mason). Applicants should:

Apply by March 1 for fall admission or Oct. 1 for spring admission

Complete a minimum of 40 college-level credits toward the AA, AS, or AAT at MC

Provide the Mason Office of Admissions a final MC transcript reflecting the transfer associate’s degree conferral date

MC students are automatically considered for a non-resident Patriot Transfer Scholarship. Students with cumulative GPA of 2.85 - 3.49 are considered for a $10,000 annual award. Students with cumulative GPA of 3.5 - 4.0 are considered for a $12,000 annual award. Recipients must be classified as non-residents of Virginia and maintain full-time enrollment each fall and spring semester. The scholarship is offered for 2 academic years. Students are required to maintain a minimum 2.75 Mason GPA.

Under this agreement, MC applicants are eligible for direct entry into 65 of Mason’s 84 undergraduate majors. There are 19 majors which have selective admission requirements that exceed those listed in Section II. These majors include:

Volgenau School of Engineering

Applied Computer Science, BS

Bioengineering, BS

Civil and Infrastructure Engineering, BS

Computer Engineering, BS

Computer Science, BS

Cyber Security Engineering, BS

Electrical Engineering, BS

Mechanical Engineering, BS

Systems Engineering, BS

Admission to an engineering or computer science major is competitive. Applicants are encouraged to present a 3.00+ CGPA. For direct admission to the major, Engineering applicants must have completed MATH 181 and 182 with grades of A or B prior to application to Mason. For direct admission to the major, Computer Science applicants must have completed MATH 181 and CMSC 140 with grades of A or B prior to application to Mason.

College of Visual and Performing Arts

Art and Visual Technology, BA

Art and Visual Technology, BFA

Computer Game Design, BFA

Dance, BA

Dance, BFA

Film and Video Studies, BA

Music, BA

Music, BM

Theater, BA

Theater, BFA

Admission to a major within the College of Visual and Performing Arts is competitive. Applicants must successfully audition for Dance, Music and Theater. Applicants to Art and Visual Technology, Computer Game Design and Film and Video Studies must successfully pass a portfolio review.

School of Nursing

Nursing, BSN

Admission to the traditional BSN program requires a minimum 3.00 GPA and completion of courses in Anatomy & Physiology, Microbiology, Statistics, Nutrition, Developmental Psychology and Bioethics. Applications are only accepted for fall admission. Students must submit two applications: the Mason transfer application and the School of Nursing BSN application.

Contact Information

Nick Mahaljevic, Assistant Director of Admissions

Email: nmihalje@gmu.edu

Call: 703-993-2000

As Virginia’s largest public research university, George Mason sets the standard for a bold, progressive education that serves their students and communities. Their identity was forged in 1972 on Virginia's strong ideals of academic excellence and service. Today, that spirit energizes them as a leader in scholarship and research; preparing graduates to meet the complex needs of a rapidly changing world.

George Washington University Websitenew window

College of Professional Studiesnew window

School of Medicine & Health Sciencesnew window

Nursing Schoolnew window

Learn About the Nursing School Requirements (PDF, )

Associate's Degree Required? Yes

Learning Format: In-Person

Transfer Agreements

Main Campus:

AS in Bioinformatics to BSHS in Biomedical Informatics (PDF, )

AAS in Biotechnology to BSHS in Medical Laboratory Sciences (PDF, )

AAS Paralegal Studies to BA in Paralegal Studies 22-23 (PDF, )

AS in Public Health Sciences to B.S.H.S. in Medical Laboratory Sciences (PDF, )

AS in Science, Biological Science to B.S.H.S. in Biomedical Informatics (PDF, )

AS in Science, Biological Science to B.S.H.S. in Medical Laboratory Sciences (PDF, )

College of Professional Studies:

AA General Studies (SSAH) to BS Police and Security Studies 22-23 (PDF, )

AAS Criminal Justice to BS Police and Security Studies 22-23 (PDF, )

Contact Information

GW School of Nursing

Mindy Galvan

Email: mgalvan@gwu.edu

Call: 202-994-7279

Jeff Delinski, Director, Police and Security Studies Program

Email: jdelinsk@gwu.edu

Call: 703-595-5487

Sara Hooshangi, Ph.D., Program Director, Integrated Information, Science and Technology

Email: shoosh@gwu.edu

Call: 202-994-1692

Stephanie Rasgus, The Department of Clinical Research and Leadership

Email: hscrl@email.gwu.edu

Yilnette Morales Nunez, The Department of Biomedical Laboratory Sciences

Email: bls_admissions@email.gwu.edu

Our students come to GW for many reasons. They come for passionate faculty, for diverse student groups, for Division I athletics, for once in a lifetime internships and for inspiring service opportunities. GW, like many universities, provides all of this. But our students come for something else, as well.

They don't just want to do a community service project. They want to meet, and then exceed, a service challenge from the First Lady of the United States.

They don't just want to view slides of art. They want to debate masterpieces in the galleries of world-class museums or dance on the stages of the Kennedy Center.

And they don’t just want to take an engineering course. They want to conduct research in a stunning new core lab facility with faculty who are quite literally shaping the world of tomorrow.

Housed in a city unlike any other, our students gain an education unlike any other. The whole city is our classroom, and our students emerge not just with a diploma, but with experiences that could only happen at GW.

Goucher College Websitesnew window

You can apply to Goucher as a transfer student if you have successfully completed more than 12 credits.

We encourage students to complete an associate’s degree and will reward you with an additional $2500 transfer scholarship. In addition, you will be eligible to have some of our Commons requirements waived if you have earned an AA or AS degree.

Learning Format: In-Person

Honors to Honors Agreement: Offers guaranteed admission to MC Honors students. The application fee is waived. Students must meet the following criteria:

Must apply to Goucher College, and meet all requirements of admission to Goucher

Must have at least a 3.5 cumulative GPA at the time of application to Goucher

Must complete or be in the process of completing all requirements for an A.A., AS or A.A.T. degree from MC

Must complete or be in the process of completing all requirements for the MC Honors program prior to transfer to Goucher

Scholarship Information - Students who meet the above criteria will:

Be considered for a transfer merit scholarship up to $20,000

Receive an additional $2,000 scholarship if a member of Phi Theta Kappa

Receive an additional $2,500 if they earn an A.A./A/S./A.A.T. degree with a minimum of 12 honors credits and a minimum cumulative 3.5 GPA

Transfer Agreements

AA General Studies (SSAH) to BA Psychology (PDF, )

Contact Information

Tina Caretti, Assistant Director of Transfer Admissions

Email: christina.caretti@goucher.edu

Call: 410-337-6017

Address: 1021 Dulaney Valley Rd, Baltimore, MD 21204

Goucher is a part of the 40 Colleges that Change Lives. We are recognized by U.S. News and World Report as: “One of the Most Innovative Liberal Arts Colleges”, “Top Academic Program for Study Abroad”, and we are recognized for “Campus Ethnic Diversity at a Liberal Arts College”.

All applicants are considered for a renewable transfer merit scholarship ranging up to $26,500. Phi Theta Kappa members receive an additional merit award of $2,000. Students who complete their A.A. or A.S. degree are eligible to receive $2,500. 97% of our students receive financial aid. Goucher has a guaranteed admission agreement with MC for honors students.

Hood College website new window

Associate's Degree Required? Strongly encouraged, but not required. Students may consider applying for transfer after having successfully earned 45-50 credits.

Learning Format: In-Person

Guaranteed Admissions Agreement: Earn an AA, AS, or AAT degree with a minimum cumulative 2.0 GPA for guaranteed admission if you meet Hood's admission requirements. Up to 62 credits accepted. Access to an Academic Success Counselor who will work with MC students through the admission process and during their first year at Hood as an academic and non-academic resource.

Honors Agreement: MC Honors students who are admitted to the Hood College Honors Program will be awarded a $1,000 per semester Honors scholarship. This scholarship is stackable with other scholarships offered by Hood. Students will be guaranteed admission to the Hood College Honors Program once they have met the following criteria:

Have applied and been accepted to Hood College as a full-time student

Have successfully completed the MC Honors Program

Have completed an AA, AS, or AAT degree and/or a minimum of 56 credits

Have earned at least a 3.7 cumulative GPA at the time of application to Hood College

Special Scholarships:

Students who transfer to Hood and enroll in a full-time basis will be awarded a special MC scholarship in the amount of $500 per semester. Phi Theta Kappa students will receive a $1,000 scholarship each semester.

Students who meet the requirements are eligible for a renewable transfer merit scholarship based on full-time enrollment upon transfer:

Leaders' Scholarship - 40% of tuition with a 3.5 GPA

Trailblazer Scholarship - 33% of tuition with a 3.0 GPA

Recognition Award - 25% of tuition with a 2.5 GPA

Students can interview on-campus at Hood to possibly increase their merit scholarship. MC students not already eligible for the Leaders' Scholarship may be considered for an increase to their transfer merit scholarship amount, based on an on-campus interview. Students are eligible for one, or all, of the above scholarships.

Transfer Agreement:

AA in Computer Science & Technologies, Computer Science to BS in Computer Science (PDF, )

Contact Information:

Whitney Yount, Admissions Counselor

Email: yount@hood.edu

Call: 301-696-3241

Address: 401 Rosemont Ave, Frederick, MD 21701

Hood College is an independent liberal arts college located on a striking and stunningly picturesque campus in the vibrant and historic central Maryland city of Frederick. The College’s well-regarded faculty and caring support staff provide a quality education at the undergraduate and graduate levels in a small-college environment that integrates the liberal arts with professional studies and experiential learning. Hood’s core values and traditions, its commitment to continuous improvement, comparative excellence, and exceeding student expectations have made it a treasured institution to current students and to more than 23,000 graduates living in the United States and around the world.

James Madison University websitenew window

Learning Format: In-person

Guaranteed Admissions Agreement: Complete an AA, AS, or AAT degree with a cumulative 3.0 GPA or higher for guaranteed admission if you meet JMU's admission requirements. Submit a Letter of Intentnew window to be eligible for transfer under this agreement.

Contact Information

Adam Anderson, Associate Dean of Admissions

Email: andersaf@jmu.edu

Call: 540-568-5681

Address: 800 S Main St, Harrisonburg, VA 22807

James Madison University is a public university located in Harrisonburg, VA with a current enrollment above 21,000. Founded in 1908 primarily as a teacher’s college, JMU has grown over the years to now offer 124 academic programs at the bachelor’s, master’s, and doctoral level. It has consistently been ranked as either the No. 1 or No. 2 top public school in the South for over the last decade - U.S. News & World Report, 2017. Recently, Kiplinger’s Personal Finance (2016) ranked JMU as one of the Top 100 “Best Values in Public Colleges.” Their College of Business is accredited by AACSB International, reserved for the top 5 percent of business schools in the world. JMU’s “impressive balance of educational, social and extracurricular activities to enrich students’ experience” earned the school a place in The Princeton Review’s Colleges That Pay You Back: The 200 Schools That Give You the Best Bang for Your Tuition Buck - 2016 Edition.

Loyola University Maryland websitenew window

Learning Format: In-person

Honors to Honors Agreement: Students with an AA, AS, AAT and in some cases an AAS receive an application fee waiver and are guaranteed admission to Loyola University Maryland if they apply by the published priority deadline of March 15, have completed at least 12 credits in an MC Honors Program, have earned a cumulative GPA of at least 3.2 and meet all other admission criteria.

Transfer Agreements

AA in Business to BBA in Business 22-23 (PDF, )

AS in Science, Biological Science to BS in Biology (PDF, )

AA in Business to Bachelor of Business Administration in Leadership & Organizational Effectiveness OR Business Economics OR Information Systems & Data Analytics OR International Business OR Marketing OR Sustainability Management 22-23 (PDF, )

Contact Information

Maureen Finnegan, Director of Transfer Admissions

Email: msfinnegan@loyola.edu

Call: 410-617-2539

Address: 4501 North Charles Street, Baltimore, MD 21210

Loyola University Maryland is a private Jesuit university. Our mission is to actively transform and inspire students to learn, lead and serve in today’s diverse and ever-changing world. We believe the time-tested Jesuit approach to living and learning is the strongest anchor and your most accurate compass for the future. Loyola is built to provide each student everything a Jesuit education can and should be: your mind expanded, your values deepened, your community broadened, your spirit lifted, your horizons widened.

At Loyola, our 4,000 undergraduate students have the advantage of an average class size of 20 students, a student-faculty ratio of 11:1 and 0 classes taught by graduate students or teaching assistants. With over 80% of our students participating in an internship, practicum and/or field experience, the 67,000 living alumni living around the world, and the unique approach used by our Career Center, it’s easy to understand why 95% of our graduates are employed, in graduate school or completing a year of service within 6-9 months of receiving their diploma.

Loyola will help you to embrace new perspectives. Shatter your preconceptions. Find your joy. Divine your truths. So that when you graduate, you’ll be ready. Ready to meet the complex demands of today. To anticipate and adapt to the needs of tomorrow. To forge and sustain a successful career that’s true to who you are. To build a life you love—and create the world you imagine.

Beginning with the start of the 2021-22 academic year, we have implemented a Seamless Transfer policy for students from Maryland Community Colleges who hold an Associate of Arts or Associate of Science degree. Our new policy means that the student will have been deemed to have satisfied Loyola’s Liberal Arts Core requirements with the exception of one Philosophy course and 1 Theology course which must be taken at Loyola (there are a range of courses they choose from). It will also cover Loyola’s foreign language requirement if the student has completed 2 semesters of foreign language study while at the community college.

Financially, we also began automatically awarding $3,000 for any student who will have earned their associates degree by the time they begin their studies at Loyola - the Community College Grant. There is an additional $3,000 grant automatically awarded for any PTK member. Both of these are stackable on our merit scholarships which for are valued between $20,000 - $27,000 this year and next fall will be $20,000 - $33,000. There’s no application required for any of those awards. All of them are renewable for up to 4 years of full-time study and a Loyola GPA of a 2.0.

Marymount University websitenew window

Learning Format: In-Person

Note: There is not a rigid application deadline; Marymount recommends that prospective transfers complete their application by July 1 for fall entry and December 1 for spring entry. This will allow ample time to meet your advisor, schedule courses and secure housing (if needed).

Guaranteed Admissions Agreement: Complete an A.A., A.S., A.A.T. or A.F.A. degree with a cumulative 2.75 GPA or higher for guaranteed admission if you meet Marymount's admission requirements. Benefits:

Application fee is waived

$250 Barnes & Noble gift card that may be applied toward textbook costs

$250 Metro SmarTrip card that may be applied toward travel expenses

Guaranteed residence hall space for students who deposit & request housing by April 15 for fall and Nov. 1 for spring

Program-specific individual advising

Honors to Honors Agreement: MC students admitted to Marymount's Honors Program are eligible to receive various transfer scholarships.

First-degree transfer students who were in MC's Phi Theta Kappa chapter and who completed at least 30 credits with a 3.5 GPA are eligible for a renewable PTK scholarship of up to $2,000. Priority consideration will be given to applications received before May 1.

MC students admitted to Marymount's Honors Program are eligible to receive a $4,000 per year Honors Scholarship, renewable while enrolled full-time, successfully complete at least one Honors course per year, and maintain a minimum cumulative 3.5 GPA.

MC students who are not Virginia residents but wish to live on-campus are eligible for a $3,000 residential grant, renewable for up to 4 years.

Scholarship Opportunities:

Students with a minimum cumulative 3.25 GPA will automatically receive a $6,000 annual transfer scholarship (excludes accelerated BSN students)

Phi Theta Kappa students with a minimum cumulative 3.5 GPA will receive an additional $2,000 annual tuition scholarship

Applications are encouraged to apply for admission to Marymount's Honors Program. If accepted, the student receives an annual $4,000 scholarship in addition to the automatic transfer scholarship.

Transfer Agreements

AAS Cybersecurity to BS Information Technology with a specialty in Networking and Cybersecurity (PDF, )

AA Interior Design to BA Interior Design (PDF, )

Course Equivalencies

Search Marymount's equivalency databasenew window to see how your credits will transfer.

Contact Information

Louis Frisenda, Assistant Vice Provost, Academic Affairs

Email: lfrisend@marymount.edu

Call: 703-247-8341

Address: 2807 N Glebe Rd, Arlington, VA 22207

Marymount is a comprehensive Catholic university, guided by the traditions of the Religious of the Sacred Heart of Mary, that emphasizes intellectual curiosity, service to others, and a global perspective. A Marymount education is grounded in the liberal arts, promotes career preparation, and provides opportunities for personal and professional growth. A student‐centered learning community that values diversity and focuses on the education of the whole person, Marymount guides the intellectual, ethical, and spiritual development of each individual.

McDaniel College websitenew window

Associate's Degree Required? Students may consider applying for transfer after having successfully earned 45-50 credits

Learning Format: In-Person

Honors to Honors Agreement: Students will be guaranteed admission into the Honors program if they:

Complete an AA, AS, AFA, AAT, or AAS degree at MC.

Complete a minimum of 12 hours of honors coursework at MC.

Students will be automatically considered for the following scholarships:

$22,000 with a 3.66 GPA or higher

$20,000 with a 3.26 - 3.65 GPA or higher

$16,000 with a 2.8 - 3.25 GPA or higher

An additional $2,000 is awarded to each level of scholarship if you are in Phi Theta Kappa.

Application fee is waived. Must apply by April 1 (for fall enrollment) or January 4 (for spring enrollment).

Contact Information

Stephanie Stahler, Senior Associate Director of Admissions

Email: sstahler@mcdaniel.edu

Call: 800-638-5005

Address: 2 College Hill, Westminster, MD 21157

At McDaniel, our approach to the transfer process is individualized. Many types of transfer students come to us and they have different goals about what they want out of their remaining years on our campus. We don't do a one size fits all approach to our transfer advising, we find out what the student wants and see if we are a good fit for them. Whether a student is with us for a year, two years or more we are still looking for them to have the McDaniel Experience, which includes being an active campus member and a lifelong member of our community long after you've graduated.

Morgan State University website new window

CONNECT Alternative Admission Program (PDF, ) — The Connect Program is a partnership between Morgan State University (MSU) and Montgomery College (MC) in which Connect participants are provided with academic and support services to aid in their successful transition from MC to MSU with the goal of retention and graduation. While studying at MC, Connect program participants will be invited to experience campus culture at Morgan State through a series of curated events designed to provide program participants with the opportunity to engage with MSU students, faculty, and staff.

Transfer Incentive Program (TIP) — TIP is a scholarship program for transfer students who intend to transfer to Morgan State during the fall term, have earned their associate degree and plan to study one of the accepted majors. The TIP scholarship provides up to $2,000 per semester for up to five semesters. Eligible transfer students must have earned their associate degree and must enroll in one of the accepted majors at Morgan. Interested transfer applicants should submit the online admissions application and all supporting documentation (i.e. transcripts). Your eligibility for the scholarship will be determined when your admissions application is evaluated. You will be notified if you are awarded the scholarship. If you have additional questions, please email us at tip@morgan.edu.

Transfer Agreements

AAS Architectural/Construction Tech, Architectural Technology to BS Architecture & Environmental Design (PDF, )

AAS Architectural/Construction Tech, Mgmt of Construction to BS Construction Management (PDF, )

AA General Studies (SSAH) to BS Social Work: Complete MC's General Studies SSAH degree.

Course Equivalencies

Use Morgan's Transfer Evaluation System to see how your credits will transfer.

Contact Information

Rhonda Shields, Associate Registrar

Email: admission-evaluation@morgan.edu

Call: 443-885-3300

Address: 1700 E. Cold Spring Lane, Baltimore, MD 21251

Morgan State University, founded in 1867, is a Carnegie-classified doctoral research institution providing instruction to a multiethnic, multiracial, multinational student body and offering more than 100 academic programs leading to degrees from the baccalaureate to the doctorate. As Maryland's Preeminent Public Urban Research University, Morgan fulfills its mission to address the needs and challenges of the modern urban environment through intense community-level study and pioneering solutions.

Located in a charming residential area of northeast Baltimore near the historic neighborhoods of Morgan Park and Wilson Park, Morgan's impressive, 152-acre campus features state-of-the-art facilities geared toward innovative teaching and learning in the 21st century. The campus, designated as a National Treasure by the National Trust for Historic Preservation, offers a safe and inviting learning environment with easy access to the best the city has to offer: culture, exhibits, dining, shopping, activities, sightseeing and employment. The off-campus opportunities also extend to community projects and civic engagement.

Morgan has graduated more than 50,000 degree candidates since its establishment more than 150 years ago, producing a passionately devoted corps of alumni who have found success in all areas of endeavor, in the U.S. and beyond. Among the nation's most diverse Historically Black Colleges and Universities, and the largest in Maryland, Morgan seeks to ensure that the doors of higher education are opened as wide as possible to as many as possible.

Notre Dame of Maryland University websitenew window

Minimum Cumulative GPA Required: 2.0

Associate's Degree Required? Yes

Learning Format: In-Person

Honors Agreement: MC students with a 3.5 GPA will receive guaranteed admission to NDMU's Morrissy honors program. Phi Theta Kappa students will receive $2,000 per year at NDMU. NDMU will accept up to 68 credits. MC honors students with a 2.5 GPA can take up to 9 credits with NDMU prior to their start term at NDMU at a reduced cost (at least 50% of the per credit tuition cost).

Transfer Agreements

AAS in Early Childhood Education Technology to BA in Early Childhood Education/Liberal Arts (PDF, )

AAT in Early Childhood Education/Early Childhood Special Education to BA in Education (PDF, )

AAT in Elementary Education/Elementary Special Education to BA in Education (PDF, )

Contact Information

NDMU Admissions Counselor

Email: admiss@ndm.edu

Address: 4701 N Charles St, Baltimore, MD 21210

For more than a century, Notre Dame of Maryland University’s approach to education has prepared thousands of high performers and instigators of social change. They are consistently responsive to the needs of a student body hungry to learn, and a world hungry for knowledgeable, compassionate leaders. NDMU embodies the pioneering educational tradition and social justice mission that spurred the College of Notre Dame to welcome the first class of women pursuing a four-year baccalaureate degree in 1895.

They offer Maryland’s only women’s college, as well as certificate, undergraduate, graduate, and PhD programs for women and men. Their transformative educational model will help prepare you for leadership and success.

Shepherd University websitenew window

See when Shepherd will be visiting MC campuses.

Associate's Degree Required? Strongly encouraged, but not required. Students may consider applying for transfer after having successfully earned 45-50 credits.

Learning Format: In-Person

Guaranteed Admission and Scholarshipsnew window: Shepherd University and MC have collaborated to offer you the Transfer Opportunity Program at Shepherd (TOPS) which guarantees your admission to Shepherd upon meeting eligibility requirements and may provide a tuition discount upon transfer.

Transfer Agreements

AA Arts & Sciences, International Studies to BA Global Studies (PDF, )

AAS Broadcast Media Production, TV Track to BS Communication and New Media (PDF, )

AS in Science, Chemistry & Biochemistry to BS in Chemistry with Biochemical Chemistry Concentration (PDF, )

AS Science, Environmental Science & Policy to BS Environmental Studies (PDF, )

Course Equivalencies

Search Shepherd's articulation agreementsnew window to see how your credits will transfer.

Contact Information

Yee Lea Cho, Senior Admissions Counselor

Email: ycho02@shepherd.edu

Call: 304-876-5356

Address: P.O. Box 5000, Shepherdstown, WV 25443

Established in 1871, Shepherd University is a public liberal arts college offering more than 90 programs. Set on a 323-acre campus perched high above the Potomac River, Shepherd provides the 3,700 student population a personal touch with a 15:1 student to faculty ratio and an average class size of 20.

Located only 90 minutes from Washington, D.C., and Baltimore, the university offers a wide variety of internship and job opportunities in local entrepreneurial initiatives as well as in national and international industries. Shepherd’s safe and convenient location opens a world of vibrant cultural and educational possibilities to students.

Along with many career, study abroad, and honors opportunities, Shepherd is also the home to the Contemporary American Theater Festival, the George Tyler Moore Center for the Study of the Civil War, the Center for Regional Innovation, and the Robert C. Byrd Center for Congressional History and Education.

Towson University websitenew window

Learning Format: In-Person

Transfer Agreements

Transfer Tiger Pactnew window

This program is designed to offer Maryland community college students a seamless transfer pathway to Towson with the additional support of our transfer admissions counselors serving as co-advisors to ensure prospective students have a clear transfer plan. Students interested in participating in this program can visit our website and complete the Transfer Tiger Pact Interest Formnew window

Main Campus or Universities at Shady Grove:

AAT Early Childhood Education, Early Childhood Special Education to BS Early Childhood Education (PDF, )

AAT Elementary Education, Elementary/Special Education to BS Elementary Education, Special Education (PDF, ) (Main Campus and Shady Grove Campus)

Course Equivalencies

Search Towson's Transfer Evaluation Systemnew window to see how your credits will transfer.

Contact Information

Main Campus: Kimberly Cromer, Assistant Director of Admissions

Email: kcromer@towson.edu

Call: 410-704-2113

Address: 8000 York Road, Towson, Maryland, 21252-0001

Shady Grove Campus: Kim Casimbon, Site Coordinator for USG

Email: shadygrove@towson.edu

Call: 301-738-6062

Address: 9630 Gudelsky Drive, Rockville, Maryland, 20850

Towson University offers students the best of both worlds. We have the academic programs and exceptional faculty typical of a large university coupled with the close-knit community and personalized approach of a small college. Research-based learning and practical application ensure that each student gets a well-rounded academic experience. TU’s wide range of programs and extracurricular activities contribute to a dynamic student experience. Students can pursue diverse interests and cultivate undiscovered talents.

The backdrop for learning is TU’s beautiful 329-acre suburban campus, located eight miles north of Baltimore and less than an hour’s drive from Washington, D.C. Throughout the entire region, Towson University’s strong partnerships with public and private organizations provide unique opportunities for research, internships and jobs. The Towson Learning Network extends beyond its main campus to five off-campus locations throughout the state.

Towson University is the second-largest university in the prestigious University System of Maryland, the 12th-largest public university system in the United States. TU is also a founding member of the Coalition of Urban and Metropolitan Universities and offers employment opportunities at all levels.

University of Maryland websitenew window

See when UMD will be visiting MC campuses

Contact College Park Pre-Transfer Advising

Contact UMD at USG programsnew window

Maryland Transfer Advantage Programnew window: MTAP provides a pathway for students at Montgomery College and other participating community colleges to earn an undergraduate degree at the University of Maryland (UMD). Students who participate in MTAP have access to transfer advising resources, can take discounted courses at UMD, and are guaranteed admission to the university upon successful completion of the program and submission of a transfer application by the early action application deadline.

Terp Transfer Partnershipnew window: TTP allows students to seamlessly transfer from MC to one of the degree programs offered by UMD at Universities at Shady Grove.

Transfer Agreements

Main Campus Only:

AA Community Health Sciences to BS Community Health, General and Health Risk Specialization (PDF, )

AA Community Health Sciences to BS Community Health, Health Communication Specialization Area (PDF, )

AA Community Health Sciences to BS Community Health, Special Populations Specialization Area (PDF, )

Universities at Shady Grove:

Additional Transfer Information

Course equivalencies: See University of Maryland College Park's Transfer Credit Evaluation System new window(TCE) for course equivalencies between MC and UMD. Guide to Using the UMD Transfer Course Databasenew window

Students majoring in any of the degree programs within the College of Arts and Humanities must fulfill a Global Engagement Requirementnew window. This may be done by completing a foreign language sequence (or ASLP100+110 American Sign Language I and II at MC), going on study abroad, or by doing a designated independent study. This requirement applies to both main campus and students enrolled in the Communication degree at the Universities at Shady Grove.

Beginning with the fall 2018 admissions cycle, the UMD will require students to submit a third party academic evaluation for only post-secondary/university credentials using either Educational Credential Evaluators (ECE) or Josef Silny & Associates (JS&A). Evaluations must be received by the appropriate deadline. Students should submit the course-by-course evaluation along with original transcript(s) and a certified English translation of the transcript(s), if applicable. The grade point average calculation and upper division course designations should also be submitted. If the evaluation is being completed by JS&A, upper division course designations must be submitted for students with more than one year of post-secondary/university education completed. Learn more at International Applicant Requirementsnew window.

Effective fall 2018, CMSC203 at MC will be accepted as CMSC131 at UMD. Effective spring 2019, CMSC204 at MC will be accepted as CMSC132 at UMD. Students will only get credit for the equivalencies if they take the class during the initial semester in which the equivalency is valid. Students who took CMSC203 prior to Fall 2018, or who take CMSC204 prior to spring 2019, will still be required to take the placement exam. In addition, students must earn a “C” or better to have those classes transfer.

Beginning in Fall 2019, Computer Science will become a Limited Enrollment Major. This includes the Computer Science (major code 07010); the Computer Science- Data science (major code 0701B); the Computer Science – Cybersecurity (major code 0701C) and the Computer Science – Machine Learning (major code 0701F) Students beyond their first semester and those off campus wishing to transfer are required to meet the following gateway criteria:

Completion of CMSC131 with a minimum grade of C- (Grade of C at MC

Completion of CMSC132 with a minimum grade of C- (Grade of C at MC)

Completion of MATH 140 with a minimum grade of C- (Grade of C at MC)

A minimum grade point average of 2.7 in all courses taken at the University of Maryland and all other institutions is required for internal and external transfer students.

Only one gateway or performance review course may be repeated to earn the required grade and that course may only be repeated once.

When more than one course can satisfy a gateway requirement, taking a second course from the list will count as a repeat.

Students may apply only once to an LEP. Students who are directly admitted and fail to meet the performance review criteria will be dismissed from the major and may not reapply.

University of Maryland Eastern Shore websitenew window

Hawk Line Programnew window (Universities at Shady Grove Campus): Hawk Line is a transfer access program that streamlines the transfer process between MC and UMBC at USG. The program offers students a structured pathway for attaining an associate degree and a baccalaureate degree.

Honors to Honors Agreementnew window (Main Campus): Graduates of one of MC's Honors Programs, who have completed up to 12 credits in honors courses at MC, will receive up to 12 credits in honors courses at the UMES Richard A. Senson Honors Program.

UMES, the state’s historically black 1890 land-grant institution, has its purpose and uniqueness grounded in distinctive learning, discovery and engagement opportunities in the arts and sciences, education, technology, engineering, agriculture, business and health professions.

UMES is a student-centered, doctoral research degree-granting university known for its nationally accredited undergraduate and graduate programs, applied research, and highly valued graduates.

UMES provides individuals, including first generation college students, access to a holistic learning environment that fosters multicultural diversity, academic success, and intellectual and social growth.

UMES prepares graduates to address challenges in a global knowledge-based economy, while maintaining its commitment to meeting the workforce and economic development needs of the Eastern Shore, the state, the nation and the world.

Wilson College websitenew window

Minimum Cumulative GPA Required: 2.0

Associate's Degree Required? Yes

Learning Format: In-Person

Enrollment Agreement and Scholarship Information

MC graduates with a GPA of 2.0 or higher and an AA or AS degree are guaranteed admission to Wilson College.

Any student who graduates from MC will be awarded a $1,000 scholarship, in addition to other merit awards, if the student is full-time with 15 credits and enrolls residentially at WC.

Any student who graduates from MC and is a member of Phi Theta Kappa will be awarded a Presidential Scholarship of $12,000, if the student is full-time with 15 credits and enrolls residentially at WC.

Students may transfer up to 72 credits to Wilson.

Wilson is committed to providing their students and their families with value in a college education. From their first-in-the-nation student loan buyback program to career development and financial literacy training, they're dedicated to providing an experience that delivers value beyond graduation. With individualized attention, the latest in technology and equipment, and rich traditions, a Wilson education has it all.
